passages.1:1: Paul, a slave of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ for the faith of the chosen of God and the knowledge of the truth that [is] according to godliness,
passages.1:2: in the hope of eternal life which God, who does not lie, promised before eternal ages,
passages.1:3: but at the proper time has disclosed his message in the proclamation [with] which I was entrusted according to the command of God our Savior,
passages.1:4: to Titus, [my] true child according to a common faith. Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
passages.1:5: On account of this, I left you behind in Crete, in order that what remains may be set in order and you may appoint elders in every town, as I ordered you.
passages.1:6: If anyone is blameless, [the] husband of one wife, having faithful<note: Or "believing"> children, not {accused of dissipation}<note: Literally "with an accusation of dissipation"> or rebellious.
passages.1:7: For it is necessary [for] the overseer to be blameless as God's steward, not self-willed, not quick-tempered, not addicted to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain,
passages.1:8: but hospitable, loving what is good, prudent, just, devout, self-controlled,
passages.1:9: holding fast to the faithful message according to the teaching, in order that he may be able both to exhort with sound instruction and to reprove those who speak against [it].
passages.1:10: For there are many rebellious [people], idle talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
passages.1:11: whom it is necessary to silence, whoever are ruining whole families [by]<note: *Here "[by]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("teaching") which is understood as means> teaching [things] which must not be [taught] for the sake of dishonest gain.
passages.1:12: A certain one of them, [one of] their own prophets, has said, "Cretans [are] always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons."
passages.1:13: This testimony is true, for which reason reprove them severely, in order that they may be sound in the faith,
passages.1:14: not paying attention to Jewish myths and commandments of people who turn away from the truth.
passages.1:15: To the pure all [things] [are] pure, but to those who are defiled and unbelieving nothing [is] pure, but both their mind and conscience are defiled.
passages.1:16: They profess to know God, but by their deeds they deny [him], [because they]<note: *Here "[because]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("are") which is understood as causal> are detestable and disobedient, and unfit for every good deed.
passages.2:1: But you, speak [the things] which are fitting for sound instruction.
passages.2:2: Older men are to be temperate, worthy of respect, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, [and] in endurance.
passages.2:3: Older women likewise [are to be] reverent in [their] behavior, not slanderous, not enslaved to much wine, teaching what is good,
passages.2:4: in order that they may encourage the young women to love their husbands [and to] love their children,
passages.2:5: [to be] self-controlled, pure, busy at home, good, being subject to their own husbands, in order that the word of God may not be slandered.
passages.2:6: Likewise, exhort the young men to be self-controlled,
passages.2:7: concerning everything showing yourself [to be] an example of good deeds, in your teaching [demonstrating] soundness, dignity,
passages.2:8: [a] sound message beyond reproach, in order that {an opponent}<note: Literally "one from [the] opposed"> may be put to shame, [because he]<note: *Here "[because]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("has") which is understood as causal> has nothing bad to say concerning us.
passages.2:9: Slaves must be subject to their own masters in everything, to be well-pleasing, not to talk back,
passages.2:10: not stealing, but demonstrating all good faith, in order that they may do credit to the teaching of God our Savior in everything.
passages.2:11: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all people,
passages.2:12: training us in order that, denying impiety and worldly desires, we may live self-controlled and righteously and godly in the present age,
passages.2:13: looking forward to the blessed hope and the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,
passages.2:14: who gave himself for us, in order that he might redeem us from all lawlessness and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good deeds.
passages.2:15: Speak these [things] and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no one disregard you.
passages.3:1: Remind them to be subject to the rulers [and] to the authorities, to obey, to be prepared for every good work,
passages.3:2: to speak evil of no one, to be peaceable, gentle, showing all courtesy to all people.
passages.3:3: For we also were once foolish, disobedient, led astray, enslaved to various desires and pleasures, spending our lives in wickedness and envy, despicable, hating one another.
passages.3:4: But when the kindness and love for mankind of God our Savior appeared,
passages.3:5: he saved us, not by deeds of righteousness that we have done, but because of his mercy, through the washing of regeneration and renewal by the Holy Spirit,
passages.3:6: whom he poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior,
passages.3:7: so that, having been justified by his grace, we may become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
passages.3:8: The saying [is] trustworthy, and I want you to insist concerning these [things], so that those who have believed in God may be careful to engage in good deeds. These things are good and beneficial for people.
passages.3:9: But avoid foolish controversies and genealogies and contentions and quarrels about the law, for they are useless and fruitless.
passages.3:10: Reject a divisive person after a first and second admonition,
passages.3:11: knowing that such a person is perverted and is sinning, being self-condemned.
passages.3:12: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, make haste to come to me in Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.
passages.3:13: Diligently send on their way Zenas the lawyer and Apollos, so that {they may lack nothing}<note: Literally "nothing may lack to them">.
passages.3:14: But also our [people] must learn to engage in good deeds for necessary needs, so that they will not be unfruitful.
passages.3:15: All those with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace [be] with all of you.
